description: {"blocks":[{"key":"950dd","text":"Although each of the water quantity protocols developed for the USDA LTAR Common Experiment addresses specific issues concerning quality assurance (QA) and quality control (QC), basic QA/QC procedures apply to many of these protocols and have relevance in field research. QA is a set of processes or steps taken to ensure that protocols are developed and adhered to in a way that minimizes inaccuracies in the data produced. QA produces high-quality data while minimizing the need for corrective measures to improve data quality. QC occurs after data generation and tests whether the data meet the requirements for quality outlined by the end users. QA is a proactive or preventive process to avoid problems; QC is a process to identify and flag suspicious data.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}
disclaimer: {"blocks":[{"key":"b657q","text":"This research is a contribution from the Long-Term Agroecosystem Research (LTAR) network. LTAR is supported by the United States Department of Agriculture. The use of trade, firm, or corporation names in this publication is for the information and convenience of the reader. Such use does not constitute an official endorsement or approval by the United States Department of Agriculture or the Agricultural Research Service of any product or service to the exclusion of others that may be suitable. USDA is an equal opportunity provider and employer.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}
keywords: Data Logger integrity,Quality assurance (QA),Quality control (QC) ,Equipment Calibration,Long-Term Agroecosystem Research, LTAR, Common Experiment, crops,USDA LTAR
protocol_references: {"blocks":[{"key":"6rnql","text":"Campbell, J. L., Rustad, L. E., Porter, J. H., Taylor, J. R., Dereszynski, E. W., Shanley, J. B., Gries, C., Henshaw, D. L., Martin, M. E., Sheldon, W. M., \u0026 Boose, E. R. (2013). Quantity is Nothing without Quality: Automated QA/QC for Streaming Environmental Sensor Data. BioScience, 63(7), 574–585. https://doi.org/10.1525/bio.2013.63.7.10","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":301,"length":40}],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"link","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"guid":"7EF6935A481911EFB3400A58A9FEAC02","url":"https://doi.org/10.1525/bio.2013.63.7.10"}}}}

status.info: We use this protocol and it's working

steps.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"594hl","text":"Avoid placing monitoring equipment in areas regularly trafficked by farm vehicles.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"bdndh","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"69fnn","text":"Mark any equipment with flagging and/or signs notifying of its location.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"8kdnh","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"8q3p5","text":"Avoid placing monitoring equipment in areas prone to frequent flooding except where required to meet data collection needs.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"fad69","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"bipnc","text":"Protect data loggers/samplers/wiring from rodent/wildlife activity. Enclose data cables and tubing in a PVC conduit to prevent damage caused by rodents, shovels or mowers, and moisture. Replace or repair any damaged equipment or wiring.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"1vec3","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"8trib","text":"Control weeds around equipment and samplers to reduce the impact of vegetation on sample collection and help keep the area visible. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"85ef4","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"blspb","text":"Winterize water samplers; apply preventive measures in the autumn to avoid freeze damage to equipment and lines, as necessary.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"6pe78","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"fnj96","text":"Check sites following major precipitation events for damage. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"2dir1","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"970g3","text":"Visually inspect the wiring and physical conditions on a routine basis (weekly recommended).","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"e8o5i","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"7euca","text":"Water quantity data are often collected using sensors and devices connected to data loggers, which function as device controllers, data storage units, and communication and data retrieval systems. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"cm00e","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"4hghh","text":"Set up and maintain a schedule for downloading and viewing data. Weekly scanning of data provides a way to determine if equipment failures need to be addressed. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"29fb","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"9qra9","text":"Check the battery condition or power supply weekly. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"tvr8","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"7233f","text":"Automate monitoring of data logger voltage to make sure charging systems are working. Verify the data logger runs reliably, and then check the system monthly or more frequently as site conditions require.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"1bqqe","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"4mr3","text":"Check the desiccant monthly (vented transducers only) or the humidity indicator; service if necessary.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"7t6i9","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"26j08","text":"Calibrate equipment and check for accuracy against true standards regularly, i.e., from weekly to bi-annually, depending on the site visit interval and the propensity for issues with the equipment and site.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"7pd99","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"7esse","text":"Metadata should document the field location, types of equipment, methods or procedures used, sampling frequency, and other information needed to accurately interpret the collected data. Metadata should also include notes about changes to equipment and reasons for these changes. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"5ectm","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"7s4r9","text":"Implement several checks of collected data to ensure they are within the limits of the sensors used and for missing data. The table below provides examples of flags for adding to data to indicate known or potential issues. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"b8sjb","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"61l0p","text":"Check data for the following aspects:","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"4kk7m","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"em96h","text":"Agreement with nearby “like” sensors","type":"ordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"33ju4","text":"Range – Do the values fall within reasonable maximum and minimum values?","type":"ordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"87lkf","text":"Missing data – periods without data","type":"ordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"4he1d","text":"Spikes – a single sudden and significant rise or fall with no known explanation.","type":"ordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"9qa2g","text":"Constant values – indicating poor sensor response","type":"ordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"d4gna","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"82gj1","text":"Flag data being made available to other users with a quality grade indicating quality levels such as pass, estimated pass, and missing. A process to assign grades reflecting the quality of the data (e.g., good, fair, suspect) is under development.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"3t9fk","text":"Data collection can be manual or digital. In both cases, methodically maintain original data. Note data corrections, gap filling, or replacements in the metadata and the data. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"5bhlm","text":"Documentation should indicate when, why, and who made the changes. ","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"r1nu","text":"Maintain backup copies of the original and corrected data in a secure (second) location to prevent losses. ","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"4nk76","text":"Table 1. Examples of the internal flags used to provide information about the data collected to field technicians and data quality analysts.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"341jj","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"4nh4b","text":" ","type":"atomic","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":0,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"2h9r6","text":"Table 2. Flags used to provide information about the data collected to external users, after Campbell et al. (2013).","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"a94c7","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"9q7no","text":" ","type":"atomic","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":1,"offset":0,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"e1rgp","text":" ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"tables","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"cellsMeta":{"0_0":"","0_1":"","0_2":"","10_0":"","10_1":"","10_2":"","11_0":"","11_1":"","11_2":"","12_0":"","12_1":"","12_2":"","13_0":"","13_1":"","13_2":"","1_0":"","1_1":"","2_0":"","2_1":"","2_2":"","3_0":"","3_1":"","3_2":"","4_0":"","4_1":"","4_2":"","5_0":"","5_1":"","5_2":"","6_0":"","6_1":"","6_2":"","7_0":"","7_1":"","7_2":"","8_0":"","8_1":"","8_2":"","9_0":"","9_1":"","9_2":""},"colTitles":["A",""],"colWidths":[200,"364"],"data":[["Missing value ","No measured value is available because of equipment failure or another reason"],["Low battery ","The sensor battery dropped below a threshold"],["Calibration due ","The sensor needs to be sent back to the manufacturer for calibration"],["Calibration expired ","The value was collected with a sensor past due for calibration "],["Invalid chronology ","One or more non sequential date or time values "],["Persistent value ","Repeated value for an extended period "],["Above range ","The value is above a specified upper limit"],["Below range ","The value is below a specified lower limit"],["Slope exceedance ","The value is much higher or lower than the previous value, resulting in an unrealistic slope"],["Spatial inconsistency ","The value greatly differs from values collected from nearby sensors "],["Internal inconsistency ","The value is inconsistent with a related measurement"],["Detection limit ","The value is below the established detection limit of the sensor"]],"guid":"99999F798D9F4EECAB1824F4064D037A","isJexcelDataFormat":true,"legend":"","mergeCells":{},"printData":[["Missing value ","No measured value is available because of equipment failure or another reason"],["Low battery ","The sensor battery dropped below a threshold"],["Calibration due ","The sensor needs to be sent back to the manufacturer for calibration"],["Calibration expired ","The value was collected with a sensor past due for calibration "],["Invalid chronology ","One or more non sequential date or time values "],["Persistent value ","Repeated value for an extended previous value, resulting in an unrealistic slope"],["Spatial inconsistency ","The value greatly differs from values collected from nearby sensors "],["Internal inconsistency ","The value is ","The value passed all quality control tests and is considered valid. "],["Estimated ","Estimated value from a model or other sources "],["Missing ","Missing value "]],"guid":"9A868D8E932945969A936A615DA1DCAE","isJexcelDataFormat":true,"legend":"","mergeCells":{},"printData":[["Pass ","The value passed all quality control tests and is considered valid.
